words.origin: Old English docga, of unknown origin.

definitions.definition: a domesticated carnivorous mammal that typically has a long snout, an acute sense of smell, non-retractable claws, and a barking, howling, or whining voice.
an unpleasant, contemptible, or wicked man.
definitions.example: he was interrupted by cries of ‘dirty dog!’

definitions.definition: used in names of dogfishes, e.g. sandy dog, spur-dog.
a mechanical device for gripping.
feet.
barriers used to keep horses off a particular part of the track.
follow (someone) closely and persistently.
definitions.example: photographers seemed to dog her every step

definitions.definition: act lazily; fail to try one's hardest.
definitions.example: Eric had a reputation for dogging it a little

definitions.definition: grip (something) with a mechanical device.
definitions.example: she has dogged the door shut

words.origin: Old English gerd (in yard1 (sense 2)), of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch gard ‘twig, rod’ and German Gerte .

definitions.definition: a unit of linear measure equal to 3 feet (0.9144 metre).
definitions.example: a full skirt that took twenty yards of cloth

definitions.definition: a cylindrical spar, tapering to each end, slung across a ship's mast for a sail to hang from.
100 dollars; a 100 dollar bill.
definitions.example: it cost two hundred up front—one yard for Maurice, one for the girl

words.origin: Old English geard  ‘building, home, region’, from a Germanic base related to Russian gorod ‘town’. Compare with garden and orchard.

definitions.definition: a piece of uncultivated ground adjoining a building, typically one enclosed by walls or other buildings.
definitions.example: tiny houses with the lavatory in the yard

definitions.definition: an area of land used for a particular purpose or business.
definitions.example: a builder's yard

definitions.definition: a house and the land attached.
(especially among expatriate Jamaicans) home; Jamaica.
definitions.example: life in Yard is no Caribbean holiday

definitions.definition: store or transport (wood) in or to a timber yard.
definitions.example: he is the last logger to be using a sled for yarding logs

definitions.definition: put (farm animals) into an enclosure.
definitions.example: sheep should be yarded even in the spring

definitions.definition: (of moose) gather as a herd for the winter.
definitions.example: they note changes in the numbers of moose yarding together
